column2: Section  183  (1)  of the  Criminal  Procedure  Code  Act  of 15  of 1979  read
(1)  If the  accused upon  being asked if he  has any cause to  show  why

should  not  be  convicted  makes  a  statement  which  amounts 
to  an
unqualified admission that he  is guilty of the  offence of which he  is  accused,
his statement shall be  recorded as  nearly as possible  in  the  words  used by

column1: him;  and the  Magistrate  shall record a  verdict of guilty and pass sentence
upon him according to  law and shall record such sentence:
